SpecificMotivation.Name: Local Civilian
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Local Civilian[h4] Please see page 36 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Lover
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Lover[h4] Please see page 36 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rival[h4] Please see page 36 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Tech
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Tech[h4] Please see page 36 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Republic
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Republic[h4] The Player Character believes in the Republic and all it stood for. He is determined to restore it in all its glory (and hopefully to what it was before corruption set in).

SpecificMotivation.Name: Honor
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Honor[h4] The Player Character has a code of honor by which he lives, derived either from personal ethics or the culture from which he hails. He sees the Empire as the antithesis of everything he stands for, and he will fight it to the end.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Jedi
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Jedi[h4] The PC believes the Jedi were the greatest part of what was good in the galaxy and that their elimination destroyed the moral and ethical fabric of civilization. He is determined to help restore them to their rightful place. Alternatively, he simply believes in the philosophy and teachings of the Jedi and knows that fighting the Empire is what they would do.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Justice
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Justice[h4] The character has a strong, unshakable sense of right and wrong, and he sees the injustices of Imperial rule throughout the galaxy. He is committed to seeing justice brought back to the galaxy, and he wishes those who have betrayed it to receive the punishment they deserve.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Species Rights
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Species Rights[h4] The Empire's dismissal of and outright antagonism toward non-humans is atrocious in every way, and this Player Character wants to put an end to it. The Alliance is his best means to see that non-humans gain the voice and the respect they deserve.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Free Enterprise
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Free Enterprise[h4] Please see page 68 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Peace
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Peace[h4] The Player Character believes that as long as the Empire remains in power, the galaxy will forever know war, bloodshed, and violence. He hopes to bring peace to the galaxy by overthrowing the Empire as quickly as possible. In addition, if a peaceful resolution can be found for the war, he will embrace it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Religion/Philosophy
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Religion/Philosophy[h4] The PC is an adherent of a particular religious order or set of teachings, or is a follower of a set of philosophical principles Whatever it is, this set of beliefs moves him to serve the Alliance.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Liberty
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Liberty[h4] Please see page 68 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Freedom
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Freedom[h4] The absolute and autocratic rule of the Emperor is an offense to this Player Character's core beliefs about governments and politics. He might, in fact, oppose central authoritarianism in all forms, yet see the Alliance as a "lesser evil" he can deal with after the Empire is brought down.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Order
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Order[h4] Please see page 68 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Progress
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Progress[h4] The Empire's tight control of galactic commerce has made it hard for anyone outside the Imperial military to create or acquire new technology. The Player Character believes that the only way to bring a new era of progress to the galaxy is to remove the Emperor from power.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Force
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Force[h4] Please see page 68 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Crime
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Crime[h4] The Player Character makes all or part of his living off of illegal dealings of some kind (such as smuggling) which has become increasingly difficult under the rule of the Empire. He believes that with a new order in place, new opportunities will arise for profit.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Political
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Political[h4] The Player Character represents a faction, planet, or sector that is part of the Alliance. He is directly involved as that group's ambassador or emissary, and the goals and motives of that group often supersede his own interests and desires.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Family
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Family[h4] The Player Character's family believes in the cause of the Alliance. Many of them may have signed on to serve in one way or another. Some (or all) of them could have died in that service. Regardless of his personal feelings, the PC fights for the Rebellion due to his family's involvement.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Military
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Military[h4] When the war broke out, the PC's unit, which was serving a specific planet or other political entity, was transferred directly to the Alliance forces. His immediate command structure may have stayed relatively intact, but the upper echelons now answer to Alliance High Command. The variety of locations (and food) makes it interesting, at least.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Intelligence
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Intelligence[h4] The Player Character has one or more contacts within the Alliance Intelligence network, and he has somehow been ensnared to do increasingly more for the cause of the Rebellion. He may owe more than a few favors, or he may genuinely care about the people with whom he's been working.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Friends
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Friends[h4] His friends left home and signed up. As soon as he was able, the Player Character did the same. He may or may not have been able to find any of them, or he may even have arrived right when they did. Regardless, he couldn't imagine staying at home once they left. Now he has to decide why he's really doing it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Underworld
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Underworld[h4] The Alliance depends heavily upon smugglers and illegal trade to get many of the resources it needs, and lately the Player Character has been aiding the Rebellion quite often. He may have already been involved in scrapes with the Empire, or that may be yet to come.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Economic
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Economic[h4] While many powerful corporations enjoy security and prosperity under the Empire's rule (and, often, patronage), other businesses suffer from lack of Imperial favor or from having had most or all of their assets were nationalized and brought directly under the Empire's logistical control. The Player Character has business interests directly tied to the Alliance, and he's around to make sure his interests are looking after.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rival
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rival[h4] Please see page 69 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: No One
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]No One[h4] The Player Character is all alone in the galaxy. Whether he is just a loner or has lost everyone in a catastrophic Imperial attack, he has decided to join the Rebellion because he has nothing left to lose.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rescuer
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rescuer[h4] Please see page 69 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Empire
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Empire[h4] The Player Character used to be a part of the Empire. He was once a soldier, a spy, or even a high-ranking official, but something drove him not only to leave the oppressive regime, but to commit himself to its downfall.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Love Interest
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Love Interest[h4] The Player Character followed his heart right into the ranks of the Rebellion, either to be closer to the one he loves, or to find a way to help that person through rescue or protection His connection may border on obsession if he's in too deep, yet he may also awaken to the greater threats he and his colleagues face.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Redemption
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Redemption[h4] The Player Character seeks to atone for past sins or mistakes by serving in the Alliance. He may have served in the Empire: he may have been a criminal, bounty hunter, or followed some other pursuit that caused him to take actions he now regrets. Helping the Rebellion may be a way to regain his self-worth.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Glory
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Glory[h4] The Player Character sees an incredible chance to do something hugely important in the galaxy, securing his place in history alongside other great heroes. He wants to fight in the biggest battles and do something so outrageous and daring that folks will talk about it for centuries. Such motivation can be dangerous for the PC's companions, yet it may also serve to inspire others.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Vengeance
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Vengeance[h4] The Empire has committed an act the Player Character will never forgive. Every dead stormtrooper and every destroyed TIE fighter is another notch on his gun. marking his endless need to make them all pay. Such a motivation can lead to dangerous, even suicidal actions, especially if the PC doesn't find other feelings with which to temper it.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Influence
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Influence[h4] Either for himself or for those he serves, the Player Character is in the Rebellion to ensure he attains a certain amount of influence when the war is over. He may seek to give his people a higher standing in the government that will follow, or he may wish to gain political power for himself in the chaotic aftermath of the war. Either way. his motivation involves the bigger picture.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Rescue
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Rescue[h4] The PC has a loved one, a family, a group of colleagues, or perhaps even an entire planet he is hoping to see rescued from Imperial control. He is in the Alliance because they offer the best chance he has to save those he seeks to rescue.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Jedi
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Jedi[h4] The Great Jedi Purge that started with Order 6 6 at the end of the Clone Wars deprived the galaxy of the single most important source of justice and peacekeeping known, at least as far as this Player Character is concerned. He seeks to restore the light of the Jedi to the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Freedom
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Freedom[h4] Whether his people are enslaved or he merely sees all Imperial rule as a form of slavery over the entire galaxy, this Player Character is driven to bring freedom to all. He serves in the Alliance for the sake of liberty, which means he will be watching carefully for any signs that the Rebellion might replace one form of tyranny with another.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Lost Treasure
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Lost Treasure[h4] Please see page 69 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Thrill
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Thrill[h4] There are few actions more dangerous than taking on the forces of the Empire in a head-on battle. It requires incredible speed, intelligence, and courage to climb into the cockpit of an X-wing or infiltrate an Imperial base. This Player Character seeks thrills and danger wherever he can find them, and he has joined the Rebellion to get a shot at taking on the most dangerous and well-trained fighting force in the galaxy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Purpose
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Purpose[h4] Please see page 69 of the Age of Rebellion Beta Rulebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Riches
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Riches[h4] While many beings desire power, fame, or freedom, some are only interested in credits. This Player Character cares only about getting paid, and he sees the Rebellion as his best shot at that. If the Empire falls and a new order takes its place, those who helped it get there should be in a position to become very wealthy.

SpecificMotivation.Name: The Sith
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]The Sith[h4] Whether a survivor of the Purges or merely a very apt student of Jedi history, this Player Character is part of the Rebellion as a means to seek out and stop whatever the Sith are doing. He may know about the involvement of the Sith in the formation of the Empire, or he may merely suspect them of taking advantage of the rampant chaos. Regardless, this motivation serves as his primary reason for fighting the Empire.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Self
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Self[h4] Please see page 32 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

SpecificMotivation.Name: Civilization
SpecificMotivation.Description: [H4]Civilization[h4] Please see page 32 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.
